Proc: Medical Thoracoscopy.
Technique:
- Local/Sedation.
- 1200mL straw fluid drained.
- Pleuroscopy: Diffuse fibrin, small nodules.
- Biopsy: Parietal pleura x multiple.
- No talc.
Disposition: Chest tube to water seal. Admit.
IP2025048_syn_2:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Diagnostic Medical Thoracoscopy. 
INDICATIONS: Undiagnosed exudative right pleural effusion. 
FINDINGS: Upon entry into the right pleural space, 1.2L of serous fluid was evacuated. Inspection via semi-rigid thoracoscope revealed diffuse fibrinous adhesions and nodularity of the parietal pleura. Targeted biopsies were obtained for histopathology and microbiological analysis (TB). Chemical pleurodesis was deferred pending diagnosis. A chest tube was placed.
IP2025048_syn_3:
Code: 32602 (Thoracoscopy, diagnostic; with biopsy of pleura).
Note: 32602 is specific to *diagnostic* thoracoscopy (often medical/local anesthesia). If mapped to surgical VATS, might be 32606, but 'Medical Thoracoscopy' usually implies 32602 equivalent context. No pleurodesis (32650) performed.

IP2025048_syn_6: Diagnostic medical thoracoscopy with pleural biopsies (no pleurodesis) was performed. Patient is a 62-year-old female with unilateral right exudative pleural effusion. IP2025048:
Medical Thoracoscopy Procedure Note
Procedure: Diagnostic medical thoracoscopy with pleural biopsies (no pleurodesis)
Patient: [REDACTED], 62-year-old female with unilateral right exudative pleural effusion, concern for tuberculous pleuritis vs malignancy.
Sedation: Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl plus local anesthesia.
Technique: Under ultrasound guidance, right 7th intercostal space selected. Approximately 1200 mL of straw-colored fluid drained. Semi-rigid thoracoscope introduced, revealing diffuse fibrinous exudate and scattered small nodules.
Multiple parietal pleural biopsies obtained; no talc instilled.
Complications: None.
Disposition: Chest tube left to water seal; admitted to ward.
